project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of the Energy Development and Conservation Project are to support: (i) improvements in the policy and institutional framework of the energy sector; (ii) development of the oil and gas sector; and (iii) preparation of an updated energy conservation program. The project is composed of two loans. First, a loan to the Hungarian National Oil and Gas Trust (OKGT) to finance the direct convertible currency component of investment subprojects for oil and gas field development, upgrading and enhanced recovery, underground gas storage, pipeline expansion and modernization. Also, the loan will finance exploration and production equipment and technical assistance. The seond loan is to the National Bank of Hungary (NBH) to finance energy conservation subprojects through participating commercial banks in continuation of the ongoing lines of credit for this purpose.
